greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, M * Q; M = (T(n,k) = A155728(n-k+1)); Q = (A155728 * 0^(n-k)).
comment: Row sums = A054765 starting with offset 1: (1, 3, 19, 160, 1744,...).
As a property of eigentriangles, sum of n-th row terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: M = an infinite lower triangular matrix with A155728 in every column:
Q = an infinite lower triangular matrix with A054765 prefaced with a 1:
(1, 1, 3, 19, 160, 1744,...) as the main diagonal and the rest zeros.
example: First few rows of the triangle =
Example: Row 4 = = (121, 14, 6, 19) termwise products of (121, 14, 2, 1) and (1, 1, 3, 19).
results.author: Gary W. Adamson & _Alexander R. Povolotsky_, Jan 25 2009
